It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"requestCancelOrFaultVoucherSet(uint256)":{"params":{"_tokenIdSupply":"an ID of a supply token (ERC-1155) which will be burned and deposits will be returned for"}},"requestCreateOrderETHETH(uint256[])":{"params":{"metadata":"metadata which is required for creation of a voucher Metadata array is used as in some scenarios we need several more params, as we need to recover  owner address in order to permit the contract to transfer funds on his behalf.  Since the params get too many, we end up in situation that the stack is too deep. uint256 _validFrom = metadata[0]; uint256 _validTo = metadata[1]; uint256 _price = metadata[2]; uint256 _depositSe = metadata[3]; uint256 _depositBu = metadata[4]; uint256 _quantity = metadata[5];"}},"requestVoucherETHETH(uint256,address)":{"params":{"_issuer":"Address of the issuer of the supply token","_tokenIdSupply":"ID of the supply token"}},"setTokenContractAddress(address)":{"params":{"_tokensContractAddress":"The address of the ERC1155ERC721 contract"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."}},"title":"Contract for interacting with Boson Protocol from the user's perspective.","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"_beforeERC1155Transfer(address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Pre-validation when a transfer from the the Tokens contract is triggered. Only the whole supply is allowed for transfer, otherwise reverts."},"_onERC1155Transfer(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"After the transfer happens the _tokenSupplyId should be updated in the promise. Escrow funds for the seller's deposits (If in ETH) should be allocated to the new owner as well."},"_onERC721Transfer(address,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Hook which will be triggered when a _tokenIdVoucher will be transferred. Escrow funds should be allocated to the new owner."},"cancelOrFault(uint256)":{"notice":"Cancel/Fault transaction by the Seller, admitting to a fault or backing out of the deal"},"complain(uint256)":{"notice":"Issue a complain for a voucher"},"pause()":{"notice":"Pause the Cashier && the Voucher Kernel contracts in case of emergency. documentation.text: @title Contract for interacting with Boson Protocol from the user's perspective.
@notice Acts as a modifier, but it's cheaper. Checking if a non-zero address is provided, otherwise reverts.
@notice Acts as a modifier, but it's cheaper. The only caller must be tokensContractAddress, otherwise reverts.
@notice Acts as a modifier, but it's cheaper. Replacement of onlyOwner modifier. If the caller is not the owner of the contract, reverts.

@notice Acts as a modifier, but it's cheaper. Checks whether provided value corresponds to the limits in the FundLimitsOracle.
 @param value the specified value is per voucher set level. E.g. deposit * qty should not be greater or equal to the limit in the FundLimitsOracle (ETH).

@notice Unpause the Cashier && the Voucher Kernel contracts.
 All functions related to creating new batch, requestVoucher or withdraw will be unpaused.

@notice Seller burns the remaining supply in case it's no longer in exchange and withdrawal of the locked deposits for them are being sent back.
 @param _tokenIdSupply an ID of a supply token (ERC-1155) which will be burned and deposits will be returned for

@notice Redemption of the vouchers promise
 @param _tokenIdVoucher   ID of the voucher

@notice Refunding a voucher
 @param _tokenIdVoucher   ID of the voucher

@notice Issue a complain for a voucher
 @param _tokenIdVoucher   ID of the voucher

@notice Cancel/Fault transaction by the Seller, admitting to a fault or backing out of the deal
 @param _tokenIdVoucher   ID of the voucher

@notice Set the address of the ERC1155ERC721 contract
 @param _tokensContractAddress   The address of the ERC1155ERC721 contract
@title Contract for interacting with Boson Protocol from the user's perspective.
@notice Acts as a modifier, but it's cheaper. Checking if a non-zero address is provided, otherwise reverts.
@notice Acts as a modifier, but it's cheaper. The only caller must be tokensContractAddress, otherwise reverts.
@notice Acts as a modifier, but it's cheaper. Replacement of onlyOwner modifier. If the caller is not the owner of the contract, reverts.

@notice Acts as a modifier, but it's cheaper. Checks whether provided value corresponds to the limits in the FundLimitsOracle.
 @param value the specified value is per voucher set level. E.g. deposit * qty should not be greater or equal to the limit in the FundLimitsOracle (ETH).

@notice Unpause the Cashier && the Voucher Kernel contracts.
 All functions related to creating new batch, requestVoucher or withdraw will be unpaused.

@notice Seller burns the remaining supply in case it's no longer in exchange and withdrawal of the locked deposits for them are being sent back.
 @param _tokenIdSupply an ID of a supply token (ERC-1155) which will be burned and deposits will be returned for

@notice Redemption of the vouchers promise
 @param _tokenIdVoucher   ID of the voucher

@notice Refunding a voucher
 @param _tokenIdVoucher   ID of the voucher

@notice Issue a complain for a voucher
 @param _tokenIdVoucher   ID of the voucher

@notice Cancel/Fault transaction by the Seller, admitting to a fault or backing out of the deal
 @param _tokenIdVoucher   ID of the voucher

@notice Set the address of the ERC1155ERC721 contract
 @param _tokensContractAddress   The address of the ERC1155ERC721 contract

params._value: qty which is desired to be transferred

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._tokenIdSupply: an ID of a supply token (ERC-1155) which will be burned and deposits will be returned for

params.metadata: metadata which is required for creation of a voucher Metadata array is used as in some scenarios we need several more params, as we need to recover  owner address in order to permit the contract to transfer funds on his behalf.  Since the params get too many, we end up in situation that the stack is too deep. uint256 _validFrom = metadata[0]; uint256 _validTo = metadata[1]; uint256 _price = metadata[2]; uint256 _depositSe = metadata[3]; uint256 _depositBu = metadata[4]; uint256 _quantity = metadata[5];

params._issuer: Address of the issuer of the supply token

params._tokensContractAddress: The address of the ERC1155ERC721 contract

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: Contract for interacting with Boson Protocol from the user's perspective.

_beforeERC1155Transfer(address,uint256,u.notice: Pre-validation when a transfer from the the Tokens contract is triggered. Only the whole supply is allowed for transfer, otherwise reverts.

_onERC1155Transfer(address,address,uint2.notice: After the transfer happens the _tokenSupplyId should be updated in the promise. Escrow funds for the seller's deposits (If in ETH) should be allocated to the new owner as well.

_onERC721Transfer(address,address,uint25.notice: Hook which will be triggered when a _tokenIdVoucher will be transferred. Escrow funds should be allocated to the new owner.

cancelOrFault(uint256).notice: Cancel/Fault transaction by the Seller, admitting to a fault or backing out of the deal

complain(uint256).notice: Issue a complain for a voucher

pause().notice: Pause the Cashier && the Voucher Kernel contracts in case of emergency. All functions related to creating new batch, requestVoucher or withdraw will be paused, hence cannot be executed. There is special function for withdrawing funds if contract is paused.

requestCancelOrFaultVoucherSet(uint256).notice: Seller burns the remaining supply in case it's no longer in exchange and withdrawal of the locked deposits for them are being sent back.

requestCreateOrderETHETH(uint256[]).notice: Issuer/Seller offers promises as supply tokens and needs to escrow the deposit

requestVoucherETHETH(uint256,address).notice: Consumer requests/buys a voucher by filling an order and receiving a Voucher Token in return

setTokenContractAddress(address).notice: Set the address of the ERC1155ERC721 contract

unpause().notice: Unpause the Cashier && the Voucher Kernel contracts. All functions related to creating new batch, requestVoucher or withdraw will be unpaused.
